Indonesian: 1. idrekening (from Dutch – used in banks and hotels), 2. idakun (used for all meanings of account apart from bank account)
1. idsetelah (also used in Malay to indicate consecutive actions), 2. idsesudah, idselepas

Standard Malay (Malaysian): zsmlapangan terbang ('airfield' in Indonesian; similar to Dutch vliegveld)
Indonesian: idbandar udara (loan translation of the English term, commonly abbreviated as bandara), idlapangan terbang

Standard Malay (Malaysian): zsmpangsapuri, zsmrumah pangsa, zsmrumah kondo (only for 'condominium')
Indonesian: idapartemen (influenced by Dutch nlappartement), idrumah susun (idrusun) (public housing for poor families), idkondominium

Standard Malay (Malaysian): zsmmajlis, zsmperhimpunan (from the root verb 'zsmhimpun' meaning 'to gather/assemble')

Indonesian: idAthena (influenced by Dutch nlAthene or from native Greek elAthina)

Standard Malay (Malaysian): zsmmakcik (also used in Riau Malay dialect in Indonesia), zsmemak saudara, zsmibu saudara

Indonesian: idautobiografi, idotobiografi is a nonstandard spelling
idotomatis (derived from Dutch pronunciation of nlautomatisch)
